trips.name: Banff Backpacking
trips.description: Multi-day backpacking trip through the Canadian Rockies
trips.notes: Amazing trip! Saw elk, mountain goats, and even a grizzly (from a safe distance). The weather was perfect except for one rainy afternoon.

trips.name: NYC Weekend
trips.description: Quick city break to see Broadway shows and museums
trips.notes: Great show, loved the city energy. MoMA was crowded but worth it.

trips.name: Family Reunion - Tahoe
trips.notes: Kids had a blast swimming and kayaking. Aunt Marie's potato salad was legendary as always.

trips.name: Portland Food Tour
trips.description: Weekend exploring food carts and breweries
trips.notes: Hit Cartopia, Prost Marketplace, and Pine Street Market. Loved the vibe of the city.

trips.name: Chicago Conference
trips.notes: Great talks on React Server Components and the new compiler. Networking was valuable.

trips.name: Austin SXSW
trips.notes: Incredible lineup! Saw amazing panels on AI in music production. The BBQ lived up to the hype.

trips.name: Boston Marathon Trip
trips.notes: Finished in 3:42:18! Heartbreak Hill was brutal but the crowd support was unreal. Bucket list item checked!

trips.name: Yellowstone Wildlife Tour
trips.notes: Saw wolves, grizzlies, bison, and elk! The Lamar Valley at sunrise was magical.

trips.name: Hawaii Big Island
trips.notes: Perfect escape from winter! Snorkeling with manta rays was surreal. Lava flows at night = incredible.

trips.name: Seattle Music Festival
trips.notes: Great local bands! Loved the neighborhood vibe. Pike Place Market breakfast was clutch.

trips.name: Japan Spring Cherry Blossoms
trips.description: Two weeks exploring Japan during sakura season
trips.notes: Dream trip! Need to book early for cherry blossom season. Priority: see Mt. Fuji, visit temples, eat ALL the ramen.

trips.name: Colorado Skiing - Vail
trips.description: Week-long ski trip with college friends
trips.notes: Can't wait! Last time we went was 2022. Hopefully powder conditions are good.

trips.name: Iceland Ring Road
trips.notes: Want to see waterfalls, glaciers, hot springs, and northern lights. June = midnight sun!

trips.name: New Orleans Jazz Fest
trips.notes: First time to NOLA! Must try Cafe Du Monde and see some live music on Frenchmen Street.

trips.name: Alaska Cruise
trips.notes: Ports: Juneau, Skagway, Ketchikan. Hoping to see whales, bears, and calving glaciers!

trips.name: Nashville Bachelorette Party
trips.notes: Broadway bars, hot chicken, and country music! Going to be a blast.

trips.name: Zion National Park
trips.notes: The Narrows and Angels Landing are must-dos. September should have perfect weather.

trips.name: Montreal Food & Culture

todos.title: Make restaurant reservations
todos.description: Joe Beef, Au Pied de Cochon

trips.notes: Can't wait for poutine, smoked meat, and bagels! Also want to explore Mont-Royal park.

trips.name: San Diego Comic-Con
trips.notes: Fingers crossed for badge! Want to see Marvel panels and check out Artist Alley.

trips.name: Scotland Highlands Tour
trips.description: 10 days exploring castles and whisky distilleries
trips.notes: Always wanted to see the Highlands! Isle of Skye, Loch Ness, and whisky tasting are priorities.

trips.name: Santa Fe Art & Culture
trips.description: Long weekend exploring art galleries and cuisine
trips.notes: Love the adobe architecture! Want to visit Meow Wolf and explore the art scene.

trips.name: Miami Art Basel
trips.notes: Excited to see contemporary art and soak up Miami vibes. Beach time between galleries!

trips.name: Patagonia Trekking
trips.description: W Trek in Patagonia - bucket list hike
trips.notes: Dream trip! The W Trek is supposed to be one of the most beautiful hikes in the world. February = summer in Patagonia.

trips.name: Charleston Historic Tour
trips.notes: Can't wait for Lowcountry cuisine! Shrimp and grits, she-crab soup, and sweet tea.

trips.name: Vancouver Island Camping
trips.description: Week of beach camping and surfing
trips.notes: Stoked to surf! Pacific Rim NP has amazing beaches. Want to see storm watching too if weather cooperates.

trips.name: Peru Machu Picchu Trek
trips.description: Inca Trail 4-day trek to Machu Picchu
trips.notes: Ultimate bucket list trek! Must acclimate in Cusco for 2-3 days first. September is dry season = perfect timing.

trips.name: Savannah Ghost Tour Weekend
trips.description: Halloween weekend in America's most haunted city
trips.notes: Perfect timing for spooky vibes! Want to tour Bonaventure Cemetery and River Street.

trips.name: Grand Canyon Rim-to-Rim
trips.notes: This is going to be HARD. 24 miles, 5,800 ft elevation loss then 6,000 ft gain. May weather should be perfect.

trips.name: Dublin & Irish Countryside

todos.title: Book Dublin hotel
todos.description: Book way ahead for St. Patrick's

trips.notes: St. Patrick's parade in Dublin! Then explore Cliffs of Moher, Ring of Kerry, and Galway.

trips.name: Croatia Island Hopping
trips.description: 10 days sailing and exploring Croatian islands
trips.notes: Dream sailing trip! Crystal clear water, medieval towns, and amazing seafood. July = perfect weather.

trips.name: Phoenix Spring Training
trips.description: Catch some Cactus League baseball games
trips.notes: Love spring training! Intimate stadiums, perfect weather, and easier to get autographs.

trips.name: Australia Great Barrier Reef
trips.description: Two weeks exploring Queensland and the reef
trips.notes: Bucket list! Great Barrier Reef before it's gone. November = summer, reef conditions should be excellent.

trips.name: MEGA PLANNING - European Summer (Heavy Todos)
trips.description: Epic 4-week European adventure hitting major cities

todos.title: Book flights
todos.description: Multi-city: into London, out of Berlin

trips.notes:
This is THE trip! Been planning for years. London museums, Paris romance, Amsterdam canals, Berlin history.

Must-sees:
- London: British Museum, Tower of London, Camden Market, afternoon tea
- Paris: Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Sainte-Chapelle, Latin Quarter cafes
- Amsterdam: Anne Frank House, Vondelpark, canal walks, bike everywhere
- Berlin: Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, Checkpoint Charlie, Tiergarten

Budget note: This is a big trip, probably $9,000-10,000 all-in with shopping & extras. Worth every penny!

trips.name: RESEARCH TRIP - Antarctica Expedition (Heavy Notes & Expenses)
trips.notes:
ANTARCTICA - THE ULTIMATE ADVENTURE!

This is my absolute dream trip. I've been saving for this for 5+ years. Antarctica represents the last great wilderness on Earth, and I need to see it before climate change alters it forever.

## The Expedition

The cruise departs from Ushuaia, Argentina (the southernmost city in the world). We'll cross the infamous Drake Passage - 2 days of potentially rough seas before reaching the Antarctic Peninsula. The ship has ice-strengthened hull and carries about 120 passengers.

## What I'll See

Wildlife: Penguins (Gentoo, Chinstrap, Adelie), Humpback & Minke whales, Leopard seals, Weddell seals, Antarctic terns, Skuas, Petrels. The penguin colonies alone make this worth it - thousands of penguins going about their lives, completely unafraid of humans.

Landscapes: Massive icebergs (some the size of buildings), glaciers calving into the sea, pristine snow-covered mountains, channels of impossibly blue water. The light in Antarctica is unlike anywhere else - 20+ hours of daylight in February.

## Daily Activities

Zodiac Cruises: Small inflatable boat excursions to get close to icebergs, glaciers, and wildlife. These happen 1-2 times per day, weather permitting.

Landings: Step foot on the Antarctic continent itself! We'll visit research stations, historic expedition huts, and remote landing sites. Each passenger is limited to 100 people ashore at once (Antarctic Treaty regulations).

Kayaking Option: I might pay extra for the kayaking add-on. Paddling among icebergs in complete silence sounds transcendent.

Lectures: Onboard naturalists, glaciologists, and historians give presentations about Antarctic science, exploration history (Shackleton! Scott! Amundsen!), and conservation.

## Practical Considerations

The Drake Passage: Known as one of the roughest bodies of water on Earth. I'm definitely bringing prescription seasickness medication. The crossing takes 2 days each way. People say "Drake Shake" vs "Drake Lake" depending on conditions. I'm preparing for the worst.

Clothing: Layering is everything. Base layers (merino wool), mid-layers (fleece), outer layer (waterproof shell). The ship provides a heavy expedition parka, but I need to bring waterproof pants. Temps range from 20F to 40F, but wind chill makes it feel much colder.

Photography: This is a once-in-a-lifetime photography opportunity. Need extra camera batteries (they drain fast in cold), lens cloth, and waterproof protection. The light at "golden hour" (which can be midnight!) is supposed to be magical.

Environment: Antarctica is protected by international treaty. Strict biosecurity measures - all clothing must be vacuumed and decontaminated before landing. No touching wildlife, stay 15 feet away from penguins, 25 feet from seals. Leave no trace. Take only photos.

## Why Now?

Climate change is affecting Antarctica faster than almost anywhere on Earth. Ice shelves are collapsing, glaciers are retreating. I want to see this pristine wilderness while it still exists in its current form. It's also about fulfilling a lifelong dream - ever since I was a kid reading about Antarctic explorers, I've wanted to go there.

## Cost Reality

This trip is EXPENSIVE. Total budget: approximately $18,000-20,000 including everything (cruise, flights, gear, insurance, misc). But this is truly once-in-a-lifetime. I'm 37 years old now - if not now, when? The value of experiences over things.

The expedition cruise alone is $12,500 for a triple cabin (sharing with 2 others). Single supplement would add $8,000! Twin cabin is $14,500 per person. I'm going with the triple to save money.

Flights to Ushuaia are complex - usually connecting through Buenos Aires, sometimes Santiago. Figure $1,800-2,200 depending on timing.

Gear: At least $1,500-2,000 for proper cold-weather gear, most of which I don't currently own. Some can be rented, but waterproof pants, boots, and base layers need to be purchased.

## Ship Life

The ship is expedition-style, not a luxury cruise liner. Comfortable but not fancy. Cabins are small but functional. All meals included (and supposedly very good). Bar is extra. Focus is on the destination and the experience, not shipboard amenities.

There's a mud room where we'll store our expedition gear and boots. A library with Antarctic books. Lounge areas for relaxing and watching for wildlife. The bridge is usually open so passengers can visit and talk to the captain.

## Conservation & Impact

I'm aware of the irony: flying halfway around the world and taking a diesel-powered ship to visit a pristine wilderness. The carbon footprint is significant. My rationalization: I'll offset carbon emissions, and witnessing Antarctica's beauty firsthand will make me a better advocate for climate action. Seeing something in person creates a connection that photos never can.

Also, Antarctic tourism is actually well-regulated and minimal impact compared to other threats (illegal fishing, climate change, krill harvesting). Passengers become ambassadors for the continent.

## After the Trip

I plan to give presentations (maybe at library or school) about the experience. Share photos widely. Write about it. Support organizations working on Antarctic conservation. This trip will change me - everyone who goes to Antarctica says the same thing.

## Bottom Line

This is the most expensive trip I'll ever take. It's also the most important one. Antarctica is the ultimate adventure - the end of the Earth, the last great wilderness, a place of overwhelming beauty and power. I'm doing this.

trips.name: Acadia National Park Fall Colors
trips.notes: October is THE month for fall colors in Acadia. The mix of ocean, mountains, and autumn leaves is supposed to be spectacular.

trips.name: Wine Country Weekend - Napa
trips.notes: September is harvest season = perfect timing! Moderate crowds and beautiful weather.

trips.name: Utah Mighty Five Road Trip
trips.description: Epic road trip hitting all 5 Utah national parks

todos.title: Book campsites
todos.description: Zion, Bryce, Capitol Reef, Arches, Canyonlands

trips.notes: The Mighty Five: Zion  Bryce  Capitol Reef  Arches  Canyonlands. Spring is perfect timing - not too hot, fewer crowds than summer.

trips.name: Morocco Adventure
trips.description: Exploring souks, kasbahs, and desert camping
trips.notes: Want to experience the chaos of Jemaa el-Fnaa square, shop in the souks, sleep under stars in the Sahara. October = good weather.

trips.name: Vermont Fall Foliage Bike Tour
trips.notes: Peak foliage, country roads, covered bridges, and farm stands. Perfect fall weekend.

trips.name: Olympic National Park
trips.description: Rain forest, mountains, and Pacific coast
trips.notes: Three ecosystems in one park! Temperate rainforest, alpine peaks, and rugged coastline. June should be drier than usual.

trips.name: Future Trip Idea - New Zealand
trips.description: Epic 3-week New Zealand adventure - Lord of the Rings filming locations, hiking, adventure sports
trips.notes: Someday trip: Queenstown bungy jumping, Milford Sound, Hobbiton, Abel Tasman, hot springs, wine regions. Need 3+ weeks to do it right.

trips.name: Future Trip - Vietnam & Cambodia
trips.description: Southeast Asia adventure - temples, street food, history
trips.notes: Angkor Wat at sunrise is bucket list. Also: Ha Long Bay, Hoi An lantern festival, Hanoi street food tour, Mekong Delta.

trips.name: Possible - Norwegian Fjords Cruise
trips.notes: Midnight sun in summer! Geirangerfjord, Bergen fish market, Lofoten Islands. Maybe 2028?

trips.name: Maybe Someday - African Safari
trips.description: Wildlife safari in Serengeti or Masai Mara
trips.notes: See the Big Five: lion, elephant, buffalo, leopard, rhino. Migration season would be incredible. Expensive but worth it.

trips.name: Idea - Galapagos Islands
trips.description: Darwin's islands - unique wildlife up close
trips.notes: Giant tortoises, marine iguanas, blue-footed boobies! Snorkel with sea lions. Need to book far ahead, very regulated.

trips.name: Random - Weekend Camping Trip
trips.notes: Just need to get outside more often. Maybe state park or national forest. Keep it simple.

trips.name: Las Vegas Convention Trip - Canceled
trips.notes: Conference got rescheduled. Couldn't make new dates work. Oh well.

trips.name: Visit Cousin - Denver - Canceled
trips.notes: They had to cancel - family emergency. Will reschedule eventually.

trips.name: Mexico Beach Resort - CANCELED
trips.notes: Had to cancel due to work conflict. Lost deposit but that's life. Hopefully can go another time.

trips.name: Florida Keys Diving
trips.notes: Amazing diving! Saw nurse sharks, giant grouper, sea turtles, and a moray eel. Molasses Reef was my favorite site.
